reviews.text:
Somewhere near to East coast lagoon food village, you can walk around here, can cycling, walking, and many other water activities.
Something not so city in Singapore to explore.

Beautiful Beach to spend some wonderful weekend with your friends and family. Especially for kids to have fun with sand and water. Some good food options around while you‚Äôre at it. Can plan picnics, just go on a walk, cycle around.

üèäThis part of East Coast Park is at Area E2.
üíÑThere is a Sand Castle building at the sandy beach area.
üèñÔ∏èPeople are obviously enjoying having a family picnic.
üèäYoung ones are having fun time at the sandy beach playing sand.
üëôSome are at the seaside enjoying a dip.
üèñÔ∏èThere are plenty of sand around the beach here to inspire people to try their hands at sand castle building.
üíÑOn weekends, lessons on Sand Castle building are conducted here for a fee.
üèñÔ∏èEast Coast Beach Area E2 is easily accessible from Bayshore Underpass.
üëôEast Coast Lagoon Food Village is close by.

Growing up in Singapore, the East Coast Beach is part of every Singaporean recreation venue. Over the years, it has evolved. What is most uncomfortable are the cargo ships and the litters, plastics, and foams. However, it is still a lot of fun for weekend surfers, kite fliers, family picnic, casual fishing, and a stroll that will take you to Changi Beach if you keep heading East. Happy weekend.

One of the beautiful and peaceful beach where you can spend morning, afternoon or an evening with your family or friends. Don‚Äôt forget to bring umbrella for the rain, water and food with you because in the morning & afternoon shops or closed. To reach at the spot you can use local public transport which is very reasonable and after that you have to walk 10 to 15 minutes to reach there.
